info.title: Control Plane Core API
info.description: Copyright Â© 2023 Control Plane Corporation. All rights reserved.

serviceAccountKey.name: Authorization
serviceAccountKey.description: Service account key can be used as API keys

workloadVersion.description: The version of the workload used during this job execution

status.description: The result of the job execution.

startTime.description: The time the job execution was first moved from pending to active. If the job execution was never pending, this is equivalent to the creation time of the job execution.

completionTime.description: The time the job execution finished. This should not be interpreted as an indication of success. Please refer to the status field instead.

lastDetectionTime.description: The last time this condition was detected by Control Plane.

lastTransitionTime.description: The last time this condition transitioned between states.

reason.description: A concise explanation of the most recent state transition.

name.description: The name of the Job objects in kubernetes

dnsMode.description:
In 'cname' dnsMode, Control Plane will configure workloads to accept traffic for the domain but will not manage DNS records for the domain.
      End users configure CNAME records in their own DNS pointed to the canonical workload endpoint.
      Currently 'cname' dnsMode requires that a tls.serverCertificate is configured when subdomain based routing is used.
      In 'ns' dnsMode, Control Plane will manage the subdomains and create all necessary DNS records.
      End users configure an NS record to forward DNS requests to the Control Plane managed DNS servers.

gvcLink.description: One of gvcLink and routes may be provided. When gvcLink is configured each workload in the GVC will receive a subdomain in the form ${workload.name}.${domain.name}

replacePrefix.description: When provided, the URI prefix will be replaced with this string before the request is sent to the workload.

regex.description:
Used to match URI paths.
One of prefix OR regex may be provided.
Uses the google re2 regex syntax

hostPrefix.description:
This option allows forwarding traffic for different host headers to different workloads.
This will only be used when the target GVC has dedicated load balancing enabled and the Domain is configure for wildcard support.
Contact your account manager for details.

routes.description: A list of mappings to workloads.

secretLink.description: The secret will include a client certificate authority cert in PEM format used to verify requests which include client certificates. The key subject must match the domain and the key usage properties must be configured for client certificate authorization. The secret type must be keypair.

clientCertificate.description: When clientCertificate is defined, requests may optionally supply a client certificate. The certificate details are included in the x-forwarded-client-cert header.

secretLink.description: When provided, this is used as the server certificate authority. The secret type must be keypair and the content must be PEM encoded.

serverCertificate.description: Configure an optional custom server certificate for the domain. When the port number is 443 and this is not supplied, a certificate is provisioned automatically.

tls.description: Used for TLS connections for this Domain. End users are responsible for certificate updates.

recoveryPolicy.description: Only applicable to persistent volumes, this determines what Control Plane will do when creating a new workload replica if a corresponding volume exists.

fieldRef.description: Configure the environment variable to inherit a value from a pod field

env.description: These environment variables will be available to any workload in the GVC. Note: a workload must opt-in to receive these variables.

dedicated.description: Creates a dedicated load balancer in each location and enables additional Domain features: custom ports, protocols and wildcard hostnames. Charges apply for each location.

trustedProxies.description:
Controls the address used for request logging and for setting the X-Envoy-External-Address header.
If set to 1, then the last address in an existing X-Forwarded-For header will be used in place of the source client IP address.
If set to 2, then the second to last address in an existing X-Forwarded-For header will be used in place of the source client IP address. If the XFF header does not have at least two addresses or does not exist then the source client IP address will be used instead.

max.description: Number of responses allowed on the replyTo subject, -1 means no limit

ttl.description: Deadline to send replies on the replyTo subject [#ms(millis) | #s(econds) | m(inutes) | h(ours)]. -1 means no restriction

subs.description: Max number of subscriptions per connection

data.description: Max number of bytes a connection can send

severity.description:
Emergency (EMERG) (severity level 0):
  System is unusable.

  Alert (ALERT) (severity level 1):
  Action must be taken immediately.

  Critical (CRIT) (severity level 2):
  Critical conditions.

  Error (ERR) (severity level 3):
  Error conditions.

  Warning (WARNING) (severity level 4):
  Warning conditions.

  Notice (NOTICE) (severity level 5):
  Normal but significant conditions.

  Informational (INFO) (severity level 6):
  Informational messages.

  Debug (DEBUG) (severity level 7):
  Debug-level messages.

Emergency (EMERG) (severity level 0):
  System is unusable.

  Alert (ALERT) (severity level 1):
  Action must be taken immediately.

  Critical (CRIT) (severity level 2):
  Critical conditions.

  Error (ERR) (severity level 3):
  Error conditions.

  Warning (WARNING) (severity level 4):
  Warning conditions.

  Notice (NOTICE) (severity level 5):
  Normal but significant conditions.

  Informational (INFO) (severity level 6):
  Informational messages.

  Debug (DEBUG) (severity level 7):
  Debug-level messages.

enabled.description: whether or not detected threats should be forwarded

minimumSeverity.description: any threats with this severity and more severe will be sent. Others will be ignored

transport.description: the transport-layer protocol to send the syslog messages over. If TCP is chosen, messages will be sent with TLS.

host.description: the hostname to send syslog messages to

port.description: the port to send syslog messages to

threatDetection.description: configure detected threats to be forwarded using a specified protocol

url.description: Url to the iam-broker Azure connection

code.description: Access code to call the function

initialCapacity.description: The initial size in GB of volumes in this set.

storageClassSuffix.description: For self-hosted locations only. The storage class used for volumes in this set will be {performanceClass}-{fileSystemType}-{storageClassSuffix} if it exists, otherwise it will be {performanceClass}-{fileSystemType}

createFinalSnapshot.description: If true, a volume snapshot will be created immediately before deletion of any volume in this set

retentionDuration.description: The default retention period for volume snapshots. This string should contain a floating point number followed by either d, h, or m. For example, "10d" would retain snapshots for 10 days.

schedule.description: A standard cron schedule expression used to determine when your job should execute.

maxCapacity.description: The maximum size in GB for a volume in this set. A volume cannot grow to be bigger than this.

minFreePercentage.description: The guaranteed free space on the volume as a percentage of the volume's total size. ControlPlane will try to maintain at least that many percent free by scaling up the total size

scalingFactor.description: When scaling is necessary, then new_capacity = current_capacity * storageScalingFactor.

initialCapacity.description: The initial size in GB of volumes in this set.

storageClassSuffix.description: For self-hosted locations only. The storage class used for volumes in this set will be {performanceClass}-{fileSystemType}-{storageClassSuffix} if it exists, otherwise it will be {performanceClass}-{fileSystemType}

createFinalSnapshot.description: If true, a volume snapshot will be created immediately before deletion of any volume in this set

retentionDuration.description: The default retention period for volume snapshots. This string should contain a floating point number followed by either d, h, or m. For example, "10d" would retain snapshots for 10 days.

schedule.description: A standard cron schedule expression used to determine when your job should execute.

maxCapacity.description: The maximum size in GB for a volume in this set. A volume cannot grow to be bigger than this.

minFreePercentage.description: The guaranteed free space on the volume as a percentage of the volume's total size. ControlPlane will try to maintain at least that many percent free by scaling up the total size

scalingFactor.description: When scaling is necessary, then new_capacity = current_capacity * storageScalingFactor.

name.description: The name of the location in which this volume was provisioned

storageDeviceId.description: The id of the volume as provided by the underlying storage implementation. If this is blank, an actual storage device has not yet been created.

index.description: This number is used to order volumes within the volume set. It is used by Control Plane to link volumes with the workload replicas that use them.

currentSize.description: The current capacity of the volume in GB

currentBytesUsed.description: The total bytes used in the volume.

driver.description: The name of the CSI driver used to provision and manage this volume

name.description: A human-readable name for this snapshot.

id.description: The id of the snapshot as provided by the underlying storage implementation.

created.description: The date and time that the snapshot was created in the Control Plane API

expires.description: The date and time on which this snapshot will be automatically deleted.

size.description: The size of the snapshot in GB.

clusterId.description: The id of the cluster assigned to the gvc in this location.

identityLink.description: The identityLink is used as the access scope for 3rd party cloud resources. A single identity can provide access to multiple cloud providers.

image.description: The full image and tag path for a public or private docker registry. Private container images must have valid credentials configured in 'pullSecretLinks' on the GVC (Global Virtual Cloud).

port.description: The port in the container which receives external traffic or traffic from other workloads. Only one container is allowed to specify a port.

ports.description: The ports in the container which can receive internal and external traffic.  For serverless workloads only the first port will be used.

memory.description: reserved memory of the workload when capacityAI is disabled. maximum memory when CapacityAI is enabled.

readinessProbe.description: A Probe to check if the workload is ready to receive additional traffic.

livenessProbe.description: A Probe to check if the workload is healthy or should be restarted.

cpu.description: reserved CPU of the workload when capacityAI is disabled. maximum CPU when CapacityAI is enabled.

minCpu.description: Minimum CPU when capacityAI is enabled.

minMemory.description: Minimum memory when capacityAI is enabled

fieldRef.description: Configure the environment variable to inherit a value from a pod field

env.description: Environment variables for the container at runtime. Default environment variables are also provided: CPLN_GVC, CPLN_LOCATION, CPLN_ORG, CPLN_PROVIDER, CPLN_WORKLOAD

inheritEnv.description: Enables inheritance of GVC environment variables. A variable in spec.env will override a GVC variable with the same name.

args.description: Command line arguments passed to the container at runtime. Replaces the CMD arguments of the running container. It is an ordered list.

command.description: Command and arguments executed immediately after the container is created.
Command and arguments executed immediately before the container is stopped.

recoveryPolicy.description: Only applicable to persistent volumes, this determines what Control Plane will do when creating a new workload replica if a corresponding volume exists.

volumes.description: Mount Object Store (S3, GCS, AzureBlob) buckets as file system

items.description: The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that are allowed to access this workload. No external access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow access to the public internet.

outboundAllowHostname.description: The list of public hostnames that this workload is allowed to reach. No outbound access is allowed by default. A wildcard '*' is allowed on the prefix of the hostname only, ex: '*.amazonaws.com'. Use 'outboundAllowCIDR' to allow access to all external websites (not recommended). The ports 80, 443 & 445 are allowed by default. This can be modified using the outboundAllowPort setting.

outboundAllowPort.description: Allow outbound access to specific ports and protocols. When not specified, communication to address ranges in outboundAllowCIDR is allowed on all ports and communication to names in outboundAllowHostname is allowed on ports 80/443.

outboundAllowCIDR.description: The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that this workload is allowed reach. No outbound access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow outbound access to the public internet (not recommended).

external.description: The external firewall is used to control access to and from the public internet.

inboundAllowType.description: Used to control the internal firewall configuration and mutual tls. 'none': no access is allowed between this workload and other workloads on Control Plane. 'same-gvc': workloads running on the same Global Virtual Cloud are allowed to access this workload internally. 'same-org': workloads running on the same Control Plane Organization are allowed to access this workload internally. 'workload-list': specific workloads provided in the 'inboundAllowWorkload' array are allowed to access this workload internally.

inboundAllowWorkload.description: A list of specific workloads which are allowed to access this workload internally.

internal.description: The internal firewall is used to control access between workloads.

firewallConfig.description: Optional control of inbound and outbound access to the workload for external (public) and internal (service to service) traffic. Access is restricted by default.

defaultOptions.description: Set defaultOptions for the workload in all Control Plane Locations.

items.description: Override defaultOptions for the workload in specific Control Plane Locations.

schedule.description: A standard cron schedule expression used to determine when your job should execute.

concurrencyPolicy.description: Either 'Forbid' or 'Replace'. This determines what Control Plane will do when the schedule requires a job to start, while a prior instance of the job is still running.

historyLimit.description: The maximum number of completed job instances to display. This should be an integer between 1 and 10.

restartPolicy.description: Either 'OnFailure' or 'Never'. This determines what Control Plane will do when a job instance fails.

activeDeadlineSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds Control Plane will wait for the job to complete. If a job does not succeed or fail in the allotted time, Control Plane will stop the job, moving it into the Removed status.

recoveryPolicy.description: Only applicable to persistent volumes, this determines what Control Plane will do when creating a new workload replica if a corresponding volume exists.

supportDynamicTags.description: If this is enabled, Control Plane will automatically redeploy your workload when one of the container images is updated in the container registry.

minReadySeconds.description: The minimum number of seconds a container must run without crashing to be considered available

filesystemGroupId.description: The group id assigned to any mounted volume

dnsMode.description:
In 'cname' dnsMode, Control Plane will configure workloads to accept traffic for the domain but will not manage DNS records for the domain.
      End users configure CNAME records in their own DNS pointed to the canonical workload endpoint.
      Currently 'cname' dnsMode requires that a tls.serverCertificate is configured when subdomain based routing is used.
      In 'ns' dnsMode, Control Plane will manage the subdomains and create all necessary DNS records.
      End users configure an NS record to forward DNS requests to the Control Plane managed DNS servers.

gvcLink.description: One of gvcLink and routes may be provided. When gvcLink is configured each workload in the GVC will receive a subdomain in the form ${workload.name}.${domain.name}

replacePrefix.description: When provided, the URI prefix will be replaced with this string before the request is sent to the workload.

regex.description:
Used to match URI paths.
One of prefix OR regex may be provided.
Uses the google re2 regex syntax

hostPrefix.description:
This option allows forwarding traffic for different host headers to different workloads.
This will only be used when the target GVC has dedicated load balancing enabled and the Domain is configure for wildcard support.
Contact your account manager for details.

routes.description: A list of mappings to workloads.

secretLink.description: The secret will include a client certificate authority cert in PEM format used to verify requests which include client certificates. The key subject must match the domain and the key usage properties must be configured for client certificate authorization. The secret type must be keypair.

clientCertificate.description: When clientCertificate is defined, requests may optionally supply a client certificate. The certificate details are included in the x-forwarded-client-cert header.

secretLink.description: When provided, this is used as the server certificate authority. The secret type must be keypair and the content must be PEM encoded.

serverCertificate.description: Configure an optional custom server certificate for the domain. When the port number is 443 and this is not supplied, a certificate is provisioned automatically.

tls.description: Used for TLS connections for this Domain. End users are responsible for certificate updates.

dedicated.description: Creates a dedicated load balancer in each location and enables additional Domain features: custom ports, protocols and wildcard hostnames. Charges apply for each location.

trustedProxies.description:
Controls the address used for request logging and for setting the X-Envoy-External-Address header.
If set to 1, then the last address in an existing X-Forwarded-For header will be used in place of the source client IP address.
If set to 2, then the second to last address in an existing X-Forwarded-For header will be used in place of the source client IP address. If the XFF header does not have at least two addresses or does not exist then the source client IP address will be used instead.

Emergency (EMERG) (severity level 0):
  System is unusable.

  Alert (ALERT) (severity level 1):
  Action must be taken immediately.

  Critical (CRIT) (severity level 2):
  Critical conditions.

  Error (ERR) (severity level 3):
  Error conditions.

  Warning (WARNING) (severity level 4):
  Warning conditions.

  Notice (NOTICE) (severity level 5):
  Normal but significant conditions.

  Informational (INFO) (severity level 6):
  Informational messages.

  Debug (DEBUG) (severity level 7):
  Debug-level messages.

minimumSeverity.description: any threats with this severity and more severe will be sent. Others will be ignored

transport.description: the transport-layer protocol to send the syslog messages over. If TCP is chosen, messages will be sent with TLS.

host.description: the hostname to send syslog messages to

port.description: the port to send syslog messages to

$replace/threatDetection.description: configure detected threats to be forwarded using a specified protocol

enabled.description: whether or not detected threats should be forwarded

minimumSeverity.description: any threats with this severity and more severe will be sent. Others will be ignored

transport.description: the transport-layer protocol to send the syslog messages over. If TCP is chosen, messages will be sent with TLS.

host.description: the hostname to send syslog messages to

port.description: the port to send syslog messages to

threatDetection.description: configure detected threats to be forwarded using a specified protocol

severity.description:
Emergency (EMERG) (severity level 0):
  System is unusable.

  Alert (ALERT) (severity level 1):
  Action must be taken immediately.

  Critical (CRIT) (severity level 2):
  Critical conditions.

  Error (ERR) (severity level 3):
  Error conditions.

  Warning (WARNING) (severity level 4):
  Warning conditions.

  Notice (NOTICE) (severity level 5):
  Normal but significant conditions.

  Informational (INFO) (severity level 6):
  Informational messages.

  Debug (DEBUG) (severity level 7):
  Debug-level messages.

Emergency (EMERG) (severity level 0):
  System is unusable.

  Alert (ALERT) (severity level 1):
  Action must be taken immediately.

  Critical (CRIT) (severity level 2):
  Critical conditions.

  Error (ERR) (severity level 3):
  Error conditions.

  Warning (WARNING) (severity level 4):
  Warning conditions.

  Notice (NOTICE) (severity level 5):
  Normal but significant conditions.

  Informational (INFO) (severity level 6):
  Informational messages.

  Debug (DEBUG) (severity level 7):
  Debug-level messages.

enabled.description: whether or not detected threats should be forwarded

minimumSeverity.description: any threats with this severity and more severe will be sent. Others will be ignored

transport.description: the transport-layer protocol to send the syslog messages over. If TCP is chosen, messages will be sent with TLS.

host.description: the hostname to send syslog messages to

port.description: the port to send syslog messages to

threatDetection.description: configure detected threats to be forwarded using a specified protocol

url.description: Url to the iam-broker Azure connection

code.description: Access code to call the function

initialCapacity.description: The initial size in GB of volumes in this set.

storageClassSuffix.description: For self-hosted locations only. The storage class used for volumes in this set will be {performanceClass}-{fileSystemType}-{storageClassSuffix} if it exists, otherwise it will be {performanceClass}-{fileSystemType}

createFinalSnapshot.description: If true, a volume snapshot will be created immediately before deletion of any volume in this set

retentionDuration.description: The default retention period for volume snapshots. This string should contain a floating point number followed by either d, h, or m. For example, "10d" would retain snapshots for 10 days.

schedule.description: A standard cron schedule expression used to determine when your job should execute.

createFinalSnapshot.description: If true, a volume snapshot will be created immediately before deletion of any volume in this set

retentionDuration.description: The default retention period for volume snapshots. This string should contain a floating point number followed by either d, h, or m. For example, "10d" would retain snapshots for 10 days.

schedule.description: A standard cron schedule expression used to determine when your job should execute.

maxCapacity.description: The maximum size in GB for a volume in this set. A volume cannot grow to be bigger than this.

minFreePercentage.description: The guaranteed free space on the volume as a percentage of the volume's total size. ControlPlane will try to maintain at least that many percent free by scaling up the total size

scalingFactor.description: When scaling is necessary, then new_capacity = current_capacity * storageScalingFactor.

identityLink.description: The identityLink is used as the access scope for 3rd party cloud resources. A single identity can provide access to multiple cloud providers.

image.description: The full image and tag path for a public or private docker registry. Private container images must have valid credentials configured in 'pullSecretLinks' on the GVC (Global Virtual Cloud).

port.description: The port in the container which receives external traffic or traffic from other workloads. Only one container is allowed to specify a port.

ports.description: The ports in the container which can receive internal and external traffic.  For serverless workloads only the first port will be used.

memory.description: reserved memory of the workload when capacityAI is disabled. maximum memory when CapacityAI is enabled.

readinessProbe.description: A Probe to check if the workload is ready to receive additional traffic.

livenessProbe.description: A Probe to check if the workload is healthy or should be restarted.

cpu.description: reserved CPU of the workload when capacityAI is disabled. maximum CPU when CapacityAI is enabled.

minCpu.description: Minimum CPU when capacityAI is enabled.

minMemory.description: Minimum memory when capacityAI is enabled

fieldRef.description: Configure the environment variable to inherit a value from a pod field

env.description: Environment variables for the container at runtime. Default environment variables are also provided: CPLN_GVC, CPLN_LOCATION, CPLN_ORG, CPLN_PROVIDER, CPLN_WORKLOAD

inheritEnv.description: Enables inheritance of GVC environment variables. A variable in spec.env will override a GVC variable with the same name.

args.description: Command line arguments passed to the container at runtime. Replaces the CMD arguments of the running container. It is an ordered list.

command.description: Command and arguments executed immediately after the container is created.
Command and arguments executed immediately before the container is stopped.

recoveryPolicy.description: Only applicable to persistent volumes, this determines what Control Plane will do when creating a new workload replica if a corresponding volume exists.

volumes.description: Mount Object Store (S3, GCS, AzureBlob) buckets as file system

items.description: The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that are allowed to access this workload. No external access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow access to the public internet.
The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that are allowed to access this workload. No external access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow access to the public internet.
The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that are allowed to access this workload. No external access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow access to the public internet.
The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that are allowed to access this workload. No external access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow access to the public internet.

outboundAllowHostname.description: The list of public hostnames that this workload is allowed to reach. No outbound access is allowed by default. A wildcard '*' is allowed on the prefix of the hostname only, ex: '*.amazonaws.com'. Use 'outboundAllowCIDR' to allow access to all external websites (not recommended). The ports 80, 443 & 445 are allowed by default. This can be modified using the outboundAllowPort setting.

outboundAllowPort.description: Allow outbound access to specific ports and protocols. When not specified, communication to address ranges in outboundAllowCIDR is allowed on all ports and communication to names in outboundAllowHostname is allowed on ports 80/443.

outboundAllowCIDR.description: The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that this workload is allowed reach. No outbound access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow outbound access to the public internet (not recommended).

items.description: The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that are allowed to access this workload. No external access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow access to the public internet.

outboundAllowHostname.description: The list of public hostnames that this workload is allowed to reach. No outbound access is allowed by default. A wildcard '*' is allowed on the prefix of the hostname only, ex: '*.amazonaws.com'. Use 'outboundAllowCIDR' to allow access to all external websites (not recommended). The ports 80, 443 & 445 are allowed by default. This can be modified using the outboundAllowPort setting.

outboundAllowPort.description: Allow outbound access to specific ports and protocols. When not specified, communication to address ranges in outboundAllowCIDR is allowed on all ports and communication to names in outboundAllowHostname is allowed on ports 80/443.

outboundAllowCIDR.description: The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that this workload is allowed reach. No outbound access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow outbound access to the public internet (not recommended).

$replace/external.description: The external firewall is used to control access to and from the public internet.

inboundAllowType.description: Used to control the internal firewall configuration and mutual tls. 'none': no access is allowed between this workload and other workloads on Control Plane. 'same-gvc': workloads running on the same Global Virtual Cloud are allowed to access this workload internally. 'same-org': workloads running on the same Control Plane Organization are allowed to access this workload internally. 'workload-list': specific workloads provided in the 'inboundAllowWorkload' array are allowed to access this workload internally.

inboundAllowWorkload.description: A list of specific workloads which are allowed to access this workload internally.

inboundAllowType.description: Used to control the internal firewall configuration and mutual tls. 'none': no access is allowed between this workload and other workloads on Control Plane. 'same-gvc': workloads running on the same Global Virtual Cloud are allowed to access this workload internally. 'same-org': workloads running on the same Control Plane Organization are allowed to access this workload internally. 'workload-list': specific workloads provided in the 'inboundAllowWorkload' array are allowed to access this workload internally.

inboundAllowWorkload.description: A list of specific workloads which are allowed to access this workload internally.

$replace/internal.description: The internal firewall is used to control access between workloads.

items.description: The list of ipv4/ipv6 addresses or cidr blocks that are allowed to access this workload. No external access is allowed by default. Specify '0.0.0.0/0' to allow access to the public internet.

A wildcard '*' is allowed on the prefix of the hostname only, ex: '*.amazonaws.com'. Use 'outboundAllowCIDR' to allow access to all external websites (not recommended). The ports 80, 443 & 445 are allowed by default. This can be modified using the outboundAllowPort setting.

external.description: The external firewall is used to control access to and from the public internet.

inboundAllowType.description: Used to control the internal firewall configuration and mutual tls. 'none': no access is allowed between this workload and other workloads on Control Plane. 'same-gvc': workloads running on the same Global Virtual Cloud are allowed to access this workload internally. 'same-org': workloads running on the same Control Plane Organization are allowed to access this workload internally. 'workload-list': specific workloads provided in the 'inboundAllowWorkload' array are allowed to access this workload internally.

inboundAllowWorkload.description: A list of specific workloads which are allowed to access this workload internally.

internal.description: The internal firewall is used to control access between workloads.

$replace/firewallConfig.description: Optional control of inbound and outbound access to the workload for external (public) and internal (service to service) traffic. Access is restricted by default.

$replace/defaultOptions.description: Set defaultOptions for the workload in all Control Plane Locations.

items.description: Override defaultOptions for the workload in specific Control Plane Locations.
Override defaultOptions for the workload in specific Control Plane Locations.

schedule.description: A standard cron schedule expression used to determine when your job should execute.

concurrencyPolicy.description: Either 'Forbid' or 'Replace'. This determines what Control Plane will do when the schedule requires a job to start, while a prior instance of the job is still running.

historyLimit.description: The maximum number of completed job instances to display. This should be an integer between 1 and 10.

restartPolicy.description: Either 'OnFailure' or 'Never'. This determines what Control Plane will do when a job instance fails.

activeDeadlineSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds Control Plane will wait for the job to complete. If a job does not succeed or fail in the allotted time, Control Plane will stop the job, moving it into the Removed status.

supportDynamicTags.description: If this is enabled, Control Plane will automatically redeploy your workload when one of the container images is updated in the container registry.

minReadySeconds.description: The minimum number of seconds a container must run without crashing to be considered available
The minimum number of seconds a container must run without crashing to be considered available

filesystemGroupId.description: The group id assigned to any mounted volume
The group id assigned to any mounted volume

get.summary: Get an agent by name
get.description: Response will contain the requested agent if the caller is authorized to view it

403.description: Not found or not allowed to view

patch.summary: Perform a Patch on an agent by name

get.summary: Query agent health

403.description: Not found or not allowed to view

post.summary: Create an agent

201.description: The agent was created successfully. The Response will contain the bootstrap config JSON text that is required when configuring an agent at a cloud provider.

get.summary: Get all agents
get.description: Response will contain all the agents the caller is authorized to view

post.summary: Get all agents based on a query
post.description: Response will contain all the agents the caller is authorized to view

get.summary: Get the access report for an agent by name
get.description: Response will contain the permissions and associated bindings (principal and granted permission) for an agent if the caller is authorized to view it

403.description: Not found or not allowed to view

get.summary: Get available permissions for an agent
get.description: Response contains the grantable permissions that are available for an agent when adding a binding in a policy.
